variants.Description in input context: D149A mutation renders DJ-1 resistant to caspase-6 proteolysis and abolishes its protective phenotype.
L166P mutation prevents DJ-1 dimerization but does not impair its proteolysis by caspase-6, although it abolishes DJ-1 antiapoptotic function.

Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using HEK293, SH-SY5Y human neuroblastoma cells, and TSM1 neurons.

Readout description.Result Description: D149A mutation renders DJ-1 resistant to caspase-6 proteolysis and abolishes its protective phenotype.
L166P mutation prevents DJ-1 dimerization but does not impair its proteolysis by caspase-6, although it abolishes DJ-1 antiapoptotic function.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple independent experiments were performed as indicated in the results section.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate or as indicated in the methods section.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector or mock-transfected cells were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Statistical analyses were performed with PRISM software by using the Newmann-Keuls multiple comparison tests for one-way analysis of variance or the unpaired Student's test for pair wise comparisons.

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y human neuroblastoma cells were used for TUNEL analysis.

Readout description.Result Description: D149A mutation abolishes DJ-1 protective phenotype in TUNEL analysis.
L166P mutation abolishes DJ-1 antiapoptotic function in TUNEL analysis.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple independent experiments were performed as indicated in the results section.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in multiple fields as indicated.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Mock-transfected cells were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Statistical analyses were performed with PRISM software by using the Newmann-Keuls multiple comparison tests for one-way analysis of variance or the unpaired Student's test for pair wise comparisons.
